items.Publication: Stroud H, Greenberg MV, Feng S, Bernatavichute YV et al. Comprehensive analysis of silencing mutants reveals complex regulation of the Arabidopsis methylome. Cell 2013 Jan 17;152(1-2):352-64. PMID: 23313553
items.Processing Description: BS-Seq reads were mapped with BS seeker (Chen et al., 2010 BMC Bioinformatics) to TAIR8 chr1..5/C/M, allowing up to 2 mismatches and retaining only uniquely-mapping reads. Identical reads were collapsed into single reads. Only reference genome cytosines covered with at least 4 reads were considered for analysis.

items.Publication: Zemach A, Kim MY, Hsieh PH, Coleman-Derr D et al. The Arabidopsis nucleosome remodeler DDM1 allows DNA methyltransferases to access H1-containing heterochromatin. Cell 2013 Mar 28;153(1):193-205. PMID: 23540698
items.Processing Description: We used Perl scripts to convert all the Cs in the reads (and in the scaffolds) to Ts, and aligned the converted reads to the converted reference scaffold, allowing up to two mismatches per read. 76 base reads were divided into the first 45 and the last 31 bases, 100 base reads were divided in half and 50 base reads were processed as single reads. Each half of the read was aligned independently using bowtie, allowing up to two mismatches. The coordinates of the two halves were subsequently correlated; the second half was discarded if it did not match the first. Single_C: We used Perl scripts to recover the original sequence of each mapped read and, for each C (on either strand), count the number of times it was sequenced as a C or a T. 50bp_window: We used a Perl script to calculate fractional methylation (#C/(#C+#T)) within a 50 bp sliding window for each sequence context (CG, CHG, CHH). All files are in GFF format. Files contain fractional methylation data either for individual cytosines (single-c) or in 50 bp windows.

items.Publication: Zemach A, Kim MY, Hsieh PH, Coleman-Derr D et al. The Arabidopsis nucleosome remodeler DDM1 allows DNA methyltransferases to access H1-containing heterochromatin. Cell 2013 Mar 28;153(1):193-205. PMID: 23540698

items.Publication: Schmitz RJ, Schultz MD, Urich MA, Nery JR et al. Patterns of population epigenomic diversity. Nature 2013 Mar 14;495(7440):193-8. PMID: 23467092
items.Processing Description: Methylated cytosine calls were made using the pipeline described in Lister et al. Human DNA methylomes at base resolution show widespread epigenomic differences. 2009. Nature

items.Publication: Zemach A, Kim MY, Hsieh PH, Coleman-Derr D et al. The Arabidopsis nucleosome remodeler DDM1 allows DNA methyltransferases to access H1-containing heterochromatin. Cell 2013 Mar 28;153(1):193-205. PMID: 23540698
items.Processing Description: We aligned 36-base Illumina paired ends reads to genomic DNA. To measure nucleosome occupancy, we counted the number of sequenced molecules corresponding to each nucleotide of the genome. To reduce the size of the file we collapsed all adjacent positions with equal scores to one window.

items.Publication: Schmitz RJ, Schultz MD, Urich MA, Nery JR et al. Patterns of population epigenomic diversity. Nature 2013 Mar 14;495(7440):193-8. PMID: 23467092
items.Processing Description: Bioscope version 1.3 was used to align .csfasta and .qual files to SNP-substituted reference genomes for each accession using default parameters which allows up to 10 locations per sequenced read. Cufflinks version 1.1 was used to quantify gene expression values using the following parameters: -F 0 âÃÃ¬b âÃÃ¬N âÃÃ¬library-type fr-secondstrand âÃÃ¬G TAIR10.gtf.
